name: Conservation Lands, Administered Lands
2019 comments: Treated same as WMA

name: CRD Sooke hills Water Supply Area
2019 comments: O&G unknown, municipal areas so unlikley to be picked up under OGAA Act

name: Wildlife Management Areas
2019 comments: Under the bc laws, reference to comply with O&G and mining although requires compliance ? Not sure how to interpret this? Low? Listed as Medium influence on OG and Mining on internal review document
notes: Details taken from forest resource table ( https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/data/geobc/forest_resource_poster_final_web.pdf)

name: Creston Valley Wildlife Management Area
2019 comments: forestry not specified but direct reference to oil and gas and mining
notes: Not administered by the Conservation Lands program.

name: Greater Vancouver Water District
2019 comments: limits on mining restriction or require corporation approval, no mention of O&G. Timber extraction can be conducted by the corporation an compulsoraily acquired but seems limited to only removal of trees. Assigned to Full mining protections although unlikly to occur in this area. No specific mention of OGAA related regulations but unlikley to be impacted in this geographic extent.

name: National Wildlife Areas
2019 comments: each NWA is governed by a management plan, governed by canadian wildlife act and Wildlife Area Regulation. It appears restrictions are only limited to surface not subsurface. Section 3(1e) prohibits agriculture, livestock or harvesting of natural or cultivated crop, (1k) carry out comerical industry.  https://www.ceaa.gc.ca/050/evaluations/proj/15620?culture=en-CA
query: TYPE_E = 'National Wildlife Area' AND LOC_E = 'British Columbia'

name: NGO Fee Simple Conservation Lands
2019 comments: Managed for conservation lands purpose. Couldn’t find specifics on industry type, only vague statements about compling with conservation goals. Spoke to Danielle Feb 5th 2020,  these lands are under the same protection as private lands, as per individual titles some older titles included subsurface rights (although this is very rare), where not specified the crown owns subsurface lands. Note there are also many of these areas with overalapping designations with Parks and Protected areas. Danielle completing the 2019 update currently and will be aded to the data catalogue. undersurface rights on some NGO fee simple lands may be owned by the NGO and thus these lands would have a “full” level of restriction on them for all three types of industry activities.
license: Open Data Commons Public Domain Dedication and License

name: Migratory Bird Sanctuaries
2019 comments: Appears that the protection of MBS is limited to above ground only (existing rights are still uphelp - similar for national wildlife reserves (http://dev.naturecanada.ca/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/PUBLIC-The-Underlying-Threat-Full-length-Report-February-2012.pdf) Check if permitting on federal land ? (federal legislation - double check).
query: TYPE_E = 'Migratory Bird Sanctuary' AND LOC_E = 'British Columbia'

name: Mineral Reserve Sites
2019 comments: O&G unknown. Limited to no registraion reserve catergory.

name: Ungulate Winter Range, No Harvest
2019 comments: Under EMPR, section 6: operations are not to be located in WHA areas. Check of tenure with WHA indicates XXXXXX

name: Wildlife Habitat Areas, No harvest
2019 comments: Under EMPR, section 6: operations are not to be located in WHA areas. Overlay of non-expired tenures shows overlap with WHA areas (indicate not srict restriction (?).
query: TIMBER_HARVEST_CODE = 'NO HARVEST ZONE' AND FEATURE_NOTES NOT LIKE '%not a legal boundary%'

name: Biodiversity Mining and Tourism Areas
2019 comments: O&G unknown. No commercial logging operations but mining activities permitted

name: Sea to Sky Wildland Zone
2019 comments: Mining and Comercial timber harvest are allowed in subsections of the wildland zone (50% area), and in some other area limited by Visual quality guidelines. Oil exploration is allowed subject to FN social, cultural and environ uses.

name: Special Wildland RMZ in Muskwa Kechia MA
Old Growth Management Areas - Legal Current
2019 comments: Guidelines specified in section 7 of the EPM, further a letter of expectation wrtiten by FLRORD for OGAA statutory decision makers outlined the % of disturbance that can occur with in OGMAs of different sizes. See References doc specifies 10% under OGMA of less that 100ha, and 5ha or 10% for greater than 100 ha. OGMA's covered under Land Use Objectives Regulations under the Land Act (previously they were designated under forest practise code).

name: Forest Rec Sites
2019 comments: Section 16 of Forest Recreation regulations specifes buisness or industry must be approved by rec. officer. Specifications under the EMPR designates rec sites as a resource feature and specifes no damage or render ineffective. Originally marked low after discusssion with Brandy but coudl be medium based on legistlation?

name: Designated Areas
2019 comments: Provisions for permits to cut and adjust the AAC included in regulation for designated areas. Covered under Forest Act
query: substr(cast(retirement_date as character), 1, 10) > cast(date('now') as character) OR DESIGNATED_AREA_NAME = 'Yale Area 3'

name: Flathead Watershed Area
2019 comments: No oil and gas exploration and designated as coal land reserve. No mention of forest/ timber although seems to have been managed

name: Class1 Coast Grizzly Bear Habitat (Coast LUP)
notes: Details taken from forest resource table ( https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/data/geobc/forest_resource_poster_final_web.pdf)

name: Nlhaxten/Cayoosh Wildland Area
query: STRGC_LAND_RSRCE_PLAN_NAME = 'Lillooet Land and Resource Management Plan' AND LEGAL_FEAT_OBJECTIVE = 'Wildland Area'

name: South Chilcotin Mountains Mining and Tourism Areas
2019 comments: Forestry restricted by tourism and mining allowed as per lilloett land and resource management plan.
query: STRGC_LAND_RSRCE_PLAN_NAME = 'Lillooet Land and Resource Management Plan' AND LEGAL_FEAT_OBJECTIVE = 'Mining and Tourism Area'

name: Special Management RMZ in Muskwa Kechika MA
Land Act Reserves (Section 15)
query: TENURE_STAGE = 'TENURE' AND TENURE_TYPE = 'RESERVE/NOTATION' AND TENURE_SUBTYPE IN ('SEC 15 OIC RESERVE' , 'SEC 16 MAP RESERVE' , 'SEC 17 DESIGNATED USE AREA' , 'SEC 66 PROHIBITED USE AREA') AND TENURE_PURPOSE = 'ENVIRONMENT, CONSERVATION, & RECR' AND TENURE_SUBPURPOSE IN ('ECOLOGICAL RESERVE' , 'ENVIRONMENT PROTECTION/CONSERVATION' , 'FISH AND WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT' , 'PROTECTED AREA STRATEGY', 'WATERSHED RESERVE')

name: Wildlife Habitat Areas, Conditional harvest

Overlay of non-expired tenures and FSW indicated overlaps present. (indicate not srict restriction (?). http://www.env.gov.bc.ca/wld/documents/fsw/171231_FSW%20Default%20Objectives%20Designation%20Procedure.pdf

name: Important Fisheries Watersheds (Great Bear Rainforest LUO)
2019 comments: some restrictions on foresty extraction within the GBR (forest Management) act to specific zones, some areas classed as Biodiversity, mining and tourism zones.

name: GBRO Area (Great Bear Rainforest LUO EBM Areas)
2019 comments: some restrictions on foresty extraction within the GBR (forest Management) act to specific zones, some areas classed as Biodiversity, mining and tourism zones. No mention of o&G but unlikley to occur in the area.

name: Haida Gwaii EBM Areas (unprotected areas on Haida Gwaii)
2019 comments: Is this the operations area as per the LUA (https://www2.gov.bc.ca/assets/gov/farming-natural-resources-and-industry/natural-resource-use/land-water-use/crown-land/land-use-plans-and-objectives/westcoast-region/haidagwaii-slua/haida_gwaii_slupa.pdf). Limited restrictions on operating areas
query: STRGC_LAND_RSRCE_PLAN_NAME = 'Haida Gwaii Land Use Objectives Order'

name: Atlin-Taku Forest Retention Areas
2019 comments: Is this still the correct terminology? I cant find details on the management plan/regulations
query: STRGC_LAND_RSRCE_PLAN_NAME = 'Atlin - Taku Strategic Land and Resource Plan' AND LEGAL_FEAT_OBJECTIVE = 'Forest Retention Area'
